Topic.Title: White supremacists or White HATERS in TX?

Message.Msg: I`m not an atheist. I simply believe if there is a God, that God will let me know it exists, maybe when I die. Neither organized religion or religious doctrine can tell me that, I don`t have faith in any religion, except as code to try and live by to be a decent human being. I just watched a c-span presentation of an export import bank conference with a corporate ceo, a tbtf bank chairman, a retired General and the president of the center for American progress(a think tank????) with a columnist from the Wash Post moderating the conference. It was a conference of real live wannabe fascists, if fascism is defined as control of society by rule of business and government. Because the underlying theme of the whole discussion seemed to be a way to forge a cooperation between business and government to determine policies that control major segments of our society. No mention of the will of WE THE PEOPLE. Especially not the White majority - they advocate for importing massive numbers of non White workers for their companies. Who are they kidding, massive numbers of them are already here, YET THEY WANT MORE, MORE MORE. We Whites are in big trouble, those elitists along with the criminals in government will not stop until they have eliminated our majority and mowed us under. It was just sickening watching those pukes.

He is such an idiot sounding man. He sounds as though he is trying to teach others what to think. What a joke. Is that why the great black wonder(like I wonder who he really is?) picked him as a running mate? He needed a White running mate that would make him look like the superior intelligent colored man?

You have got to be kidding me. Dittoheads don't have brains, just mouths.

Oh Dan, for you and your Soc.Sec./Medicare-loving Tea Brains to accuse me of being government dependent is just ridiculous. You may dress up your love of big government transfer payments in Tea Brain rhetoric--heck, you probably even believe it--but I know exactly what you are.

Message.Title: AT & T = THIEF'S
Message.Msg: AT & T = THIEF'S I have been with AT & T for one year and I can not even begin to describe the disappointment. First, my monthly payments are over $110 (which is what I signed up for) but I did not consent to the costly late fees which are about $50 if you go one day over your bill due date. When calling to set up a payment system I scheduled it for the 10th of the next month only to wake up on the 8th of the month with my phone disconnected with NO WAY to reach their company via phone and ANOTHER $50 fee which is now $300 FOR ONE MONTH of service! After calling AT & T to describe the miscommunication I was told AT & T is not reliable FROM THE MOUTH OF THE REPRESENTATIVE, after nicely asking to be transferred to another representative which is going to help me find a solution I get the dial tone, YES I was hung up on after waiting on the line for almost an hour! AND THAT IS ONLY THE TIP OF THE ICEBERG, when I originally signed my contract I was under the impression by the associate that I was signing a 12 month contract. FINALLY, my one year has came to an end and I called AT & T to let them know I WILL NOT BE RENEWING MY CONTRACT and I was faced with the unfortunate news that they have extended my contract to another 12 months making my contract now a 24 month process. Within the first year of being with AT & T I have paid almost $5,000.00!!!!! I am so displeased with their service I am going to make sure AS MANY PEOPLE KNOW THAT AT & T ARE THIEF'S AND FRAUDS before going forward and signing your life away to them. Sincerely, A Meaningless Customer to AT & T #ATTFAILS
I expect continued declines this week with a turn up next week. Still expecting $40 in June.
great report!

Seems to me you are blaming AT&T for a lot of your short comings. The late fee does seem pretty steep but, if you pay on time, you don't need to pay it. It would probably also help if you read your contract. I'm sure most of the $5,000 was for toll calls. The service you are signed up for probably doesn't fit your real needs.

The problem of course is that a good many of them will stay in the dark, don't want to pay taxes, and don't want to become citizens. If they do, then when they get into trouble or run out of work it is harder to go back to Mexico or Central America. "When all those illegal’s get added to the tax rolls, the burden on Ricky and Echo will go down a bit." The rain in Spain falls mainly on the plain! By Jove I think he's got it! More working age people means more people working means a larger economy. Not only that, you're going to need someone to change your bed pan for you. It ain't gonna be me. Well, maybe if you pay me two grand a #$%$. "and don't want to become citizens. Who cares if they want to become citizens? I want legal immigrants building the economy and paying taxes. Lots of them. If they become citizens, great. If not, just as great. If they do, then when they get into trouble or run out of work it is harder to go back to Mexico or Central America." Where do you get the idea it is harder for legal immigrants and US citizens to cross borders? That's just nuts. Also, do you have any ideas on the specific steps Barack Obama can take to "stop pretending he's President without his being black"?

He can do it in just four days. Buy a credit call spread on this weeks AT&T options. Buy the 38.5 calls and sell the 37.5 calls for a $30 net credit on each contract. He will need 167 contracts to make his $5,000. All the contracts will expire worthless on Friday and he can keep the $5,000 that he got from the sale. It sounds so good I think I will do it myself.

Now Zon, if Old Wilkie fessed up to dropping 340K prior to figuring out how to beat the street, please don't include me in "We can take it to he bank" regarding his option game. I'll stick with my tried and true method that has over 33 years of proven profit making without losing a cent. I'll leave Wilkie and his followers to their own devices and stick to mine. I can't understand why people with seemingly legitimate complaints choose to air their grievances out in a public message board. Do they think for one moment someone is going to say "Thats it. I'm selling my T stock and will tell everyone I know to run away from T as fast as possible" because of Catucci's...or anyone else's horror story? Those complainers rank right up with the Spammers and social commentators who infest the boards. I report spammers (probably does no good) and use ignore on those with their social/political commentary BS. If Cattuci, or anyone for that matter has a billing problem, take it to small claims court and potentially get some satisfaction that way. Hell, I stopped reading his tale after about 3 sentences.
There you go Wilkie. Sage advice to solve his problem. I knew you'd have the solution! You should add the caveat that "past performance is not indicative of future results" to protect yourself...

Topic.Title: AT&T network outrage in my area. I can't do transaction untill they fix the problem

Message.Msg: True it was Sunday, but there's no way of knowing when the supposed "outage" occurred. I'm always suspicious of posts like that Wilkie. You know, a complaint on a message board? What in the hell good does posting here accomplish? The fact he doesn't have an app to do business I find fishy. Especially when he writes that he can't network to his home computer? Sounds like the iPhone was working when something else was at fault. Lack of response tells me a troll type trying to stir up trouble.

Let's see if I get this Wilkie. You say T will be 40 in June. It hasn't seen the 40's in about 5 years. Yet, your looking for a price of 37.50 for your latest play right? If you're betting T goes lower than it is now for your next trade..and you keep using your up a little,....down a little gambit...how will it ever get to 40? I know I'm missing something in your postings. You're saying T will run up another 6%. Yet, you keep wagering on lower prices while covering yourself with minimal incremental increases? Or vice-versa, depending how the wind is blowing. I don't understand your forecast of 40 anymore than the contract trades you write about. What ever happened to buying, owning and letting dividends and modest stock appreciation work for you over time? I would think -340K would have taught you to reconsider your tactics. Do you do this with any other stock, or just T? If not, how come T is your stock of choice?
